mapper.insert: insert into ec_cust_edu (cust_no, edu_typ, school_nam, edu_cd, degree_cd, speciality1, speciality2, speciality3, entrance_date, graduate_date, create_date, create_time, create_user, update_date, update_time, update_user, time_stamp, rec_stat ) values (#{custNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{eduTyp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{schoolNam,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{eduCd,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{degreeCd,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{speciality1,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{speciality2,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{speciality3,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{entranceDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{graduateDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{timeStamp,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{recStat,jdbcType=VARCHAR} )
mapper.update: update ec_cust_edu set school_nam = #{schoolNam,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, edu_cd = #{eduCd,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, degree_cd = #{degreeCd,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, speciality1 = #{speciality1,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, speciality2 = #{speciality2,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, speciality3 = #{speciality3,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, entrance_date = #{entranceDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, graduate_date = #{graduateDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_user = #{createUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_time = #{updateTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update_user = #{updateUser,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, time_stamp = #{timeStamp,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, rec_stat = #{recStat,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where cust_no = #{custNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR} and edu_typ = #{eduTyp,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select cust_no, edu_typ, school_nam, edu_cd, degree_cd, speciality1, speciality2, speciality3, entrance_date, graduate_date, create_date, create_time, create_user, update_date, update_time, update_user, time_stamp, rec_stat from ec_cust_edu

select cust_no, edu_typ, school_nam, edu_cd, degree_cd, speciality1, speciality2, speciality3, entrance_date, graduate_date, create_date, create_time, create_user, update_date, update_time, update_user, time_stamp, rec_stat from ec_cust_edu where cust_no = #{custNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR} and rec_stat = '0' and edu_typ = (SELECT min(d.edu_typ) from ec_cust_edu d where d.cust_no = #{custNo,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
